Steam (ST): News of the drifter, Furudo Erika, quickly spread across Rokkenjima.
Umineko Project (UP): The news about the drifter, Furudo Erika, quickly spread across Rokkenjima.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 漂着者、古戸ヱリカの一報は、すぐに六軒島を駆け巡った。
Russian (RU): По Роккенджиме быстро разошлась новость о сошедшей на берег Фурудо Эрике.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As notícias sobre a náufraga, Furudo Erika, rapidamente se espalharam por Rokkenjima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 漂流至島者——古戶繪梨花一事，馬上傳遍了整個六軒島。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 漂流至岛者——古户绘梨花一事，马上传遍了整个六轩岛。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Le notizie sulla naufraga, Furudo Erika, si sparsero velocemente attraverso Rokkenjima.

Steam (ST): Erika had been welcomed in politely, and it was decided that she would be treated as a guest until the typhoon passed.
Umineko Project (UP): Erika was politely entertained, and it was decided that she would be treated as a guest until the typhoon passed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika had been politely entertained, and it was decided that she would be treated as a guest until the typhoon passed.
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカは丁重にもてなされ、台風が過ぎ去るまでの間、客人として迎えられることになるのだった。
Russian (RU): Эрику приняли вежливо, и было решено до окончания тайфуна отнестись к ней как к гостье.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika foi recebida com muita hospitalidade, e ficou decidido que ela deveria ser tratada como uma convidada até que o tufão passasse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花受到了鄭重的招待，被歡迎為了台風離去前的那段時間裡的客人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花受到了郑重的招待，被欢迎为了台风离去前的那段时间里的客人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erika era stata gentilmente intrattenuta, e fu deciso che sarebbe stata trattata come un'ospite finché il tifone non sarebbe passato.

Steam (ST): In the dining hall, Gohda's wonderful dinner had ended, and everyone was relaxing and enjoying some after-dinner coffee and cheese...
Umineko Project (UP): In the dining hall, Gohda's wonderful dinner had ended, and everyone was relaxing and enjoying some after‐dinner coffee and cheese......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the dining hall, Gohda's wonderful dinner had ended, and everyone was relaxing and enjoying some after-dinner coffee and cheese......
PC Japanese (JP): 食堂は、郷田による素晴らしい晩餐も終わり、コーヒーとチーズが並ぶ、和やかな食後のひと時になっていた……。
Russian (RU): В столовой чудесный ужин Годы подошёл к концу, и все отдыхали, наслаждаясь послеобеденным кофе и сыром......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na sala de jantar, o deslumbrante jantar de Gohda havia chegado ao fim, e todos estavam descansando e aproveitando uma xícara de café junto a um bom queijo......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 餐廳中，出自鄉田之手的精美晚餐已經結束，擺上了咖啡與奶酪，正在進行和樂融融的飯後小憩……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 餐厅中，出自乡田之手的精美晚餐已经结束，摆上了咖啡与奶酪，正在进行和乐融融的饭后小憩……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nella sala da pranzo, la stupenda cena di Gohda era finita, e tutti si stavano rilassando e godendosi del caffè e del formaggio per il dopocena...

Steam (ST): Apparently, Battler was a bit relieved that Erika had come and turned into a good scapegoat. It drove away some of the attention he'd been getting piled on him for finally coming back after six years.
Umineko Project (UP): Apparently, Battler was a bit relieved that Erika had come and turned into a good scapegoat. It drove away some of the attention he'd been getting piled on him for finally coming back after six years.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Apparently, Battler was a bit relieved that Erika had come and turned into a good scapegoat. It drove away some of the attention he'd been getting piled on him for finally coming back after six years.
PC Japanese (JP): ６年ぶりということで注目を浴びて照れ臭かった戦人にとっては、ヱリカというちょうどいいスケープゴートが現れてくれて安心、という感じだった。
Russian (RU): Баттлер даже обрадовался появлению Эрики — нового козла отпущения. Всеобщее внимание было приковано к ней, и на него перестали вешаться за то, что он спустя шесть лет наконец вернулся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Battler parecia aliviado que a chegada de Erika havia se tornado um bode expiatório. Ela atraiu para si toda a atenção que estaria depositada sobre ele devido ao seu retorno após seis anos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對於因 6 年沒來而飽受注目到人都難為情了的戰人來說，繪梨花這只來得正好的“替罪羊”的出現，乃是讓他鬆了口氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对于因 6 年没来而饱受注目到人都难为情了的战人来说，绘梨花这只来得正好的“替罪羊”的出现，乃是让他松了口气。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A quanto pare, Battler era alquanto sollevato del fatto che Erika fosse venuta e fosse diventata un capro espiatorio. Ciò portò via l'attenzione che si stava accumulando su di lui per essere finalmente venuto dopo sei anni.

Steam (ST): In fact, she turned out to be very talkative.
Umineko Project (UP): In fact, she turned out to be very talkative.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In fact, she turned out to be very talkative.
PC Japanese (JP): それどころか、むしろ彼女は饒舌。
Russian (RU): На деле она оказалась весьма разговорчивой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao contrário do que se esperava, ela era realmente conversadora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 豈止如此，莫如說反倒是她在口若懸河。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 岂止如此，莫如说反倒是她在口若悬河。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anzi, l'ospite si rivelò essere molto loquace.

Steam (ST): When the conversation turned to a sophisticated discussion of the mystery genre, even the adults were drawn in.
Umineko Project (UP): When the conversation turned to a sophisticated discussion of the mystery genre, even the adults were drawn in.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the conversation turned to a sophisticated discussion of the mystery genre, even the adults were drawn in.
PC Japanese (JP): 高尚なミステリー談義を始め、すっかり大人たちも巻き込まれてしまった。
Russian (RU): Когда разговор перешёл к сложному обсуждению детективного жанра, даже взрослые присоединились.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a conversa mudou de rumos e transformou‐se em uma sofisticada discussão sobre romances policiais, até mesmo os adultos foram atraídos por ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一開始高尚的推理劇講座，大人們是徹底地被她的步調牽著走了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一开始高尚的推理剧讲座，大人们是彻底地被她的步调牵着走了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando la conversazione si trasformò in una sofisticata discussione circa il genere giallo, persino gli adulti ne furono coinvolti.

Steam (ST): She was apparently so well-versed that even Nanjo, who had a vast knowledge of the subject, was impressed.
Umineko Project (UP): She was apparently so well versed that even Nanjo, who had a vast knowledge of the subject, was impressed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She was apparently so well versed that even Nanjo, who had a vast knowledge of the subject, was impressed.
PC Japanese (JP): ミステリーに造詣のある南條も舌を巻くほどの知識の深さだという。
Russian (RU): Она была так хорошо осведомлена, что поразился даже Нанджо с его обширными знаниями в этой области.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika demonstrava‐se ser tão versada quanto Nanjo, que detinha de um grande conhecimento do assunto, ao ponto de deixá‐lo impressionado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 其知識貌似是深到了，連對推理劇頗有造詣的南條都為之咋舌。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 其知识貌似是深到了，连对推理剧颇有造诣的南条都为之咋舌。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Apparentemente, era talmente esperta sull'argomento che persino Nanjo, che ne aveva una vasta conoscenza, era impressionato.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Wahahaha, good point. A strange family in a western mansion on an isolated island during a storm. Now that we have a detective stopping by to take shelter from the rain, we've got all the major factors lined up."
Umineko Project (UP): "Wahahaha, good point. A strange family in a Western mansion on an isolated island during a storm. Now that we have a detective stopping by to take shelter from the rain, we've got all the major factors lined up."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Wahahaha, good point. A strange family in a western mansion on an isolated island during a storm. Now that we have a detective stopping by to take shelter from the rain, we've got all the major factors lined up."
PC Japanese (JP): 「わっはっはっは、確かにな。嵐の孤島に洋館に不気味な一族。そこに雨宿りの探偵と来りゃ、もうお膳立てが揃ったも同然だぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わっはっはっは、確かにな。嵐の孤島に洋館に不気味な一族。そこに雨宿りの探偵と来りゃ、もうお膳立てが揃ったも同然だぜ」
Russian (RU): "Ва‐ха‐ха, точно. Странная семья в западном особняке на уединённом острове во время шторма. Когда у нас остановился детектив, чтобы укрыться от дождя, выстроились в ряд все основные факторы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Wahahaha, realmente. Uma estranha família em uma mansão estilo ocidental localizada em uma ilha isolada pela tempestade. Agora que uma detetive fez uma parada aqui para se abrigar da chuva, os principais fatores foram alinhados."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哇哈哈哈，的確啊。暴風雨孤島、洋館、陰森的家族。這時候再來個避雨的偵探，那就已是等於萬事具備了啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哇哈哈哈，的确啊。暴风雨孤岛、洋馆、阴森的家族。这时候再来个避雨的侦探，那就已是等于万事具备了啊。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Wahahaha, verissimo. Una strana famiglia in una residenza occidentale su un'isola separata dal resto del mondo durante una tempesta. Ora che abbiamo un detective che si ferma qui per rifugiarsi dalla pioggia, abbiamo tutti gli elementi principali allineati."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Have no fear. No matter how difficult the crime, I will solve it. That's a detective's job."
Umineko Project (UP): "Have no fear. No matter how difficult the crime, I will solve it. That's a detective's job."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「ご安心を。どんな難事件であっても解決してお見せしますので。それが探偵の務めです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ご安心を。どんな難事件であっても解決してお見せしますので。それが探偵の務めです」
Russian (RU): "Не бойтесь. Каким бы сложным преступление ни оказалось, я разгадаю его. Такова работа детектива."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não temam. Não importa o quão complexo seja o caso, eu irei resolvê‐lo. Esse é o trabalho de um detetive."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「請放心。不論發生怎樣的難解案件，我皆會破給大家看。這即是偵探的義務。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「请放心。不论发生怎样的难解案件，我皆会破给大家看。这即是侦探的义务。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non abbiate paura. Per quanto complicato sia il crimine, io lo risolverò. {n}È questo il lavoro di un detective."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): "How reassuring. It almost sounds as though you want a bizarre crime to occur. I hope I don't have to play the part of the victim."
Umineko Project (UP): "How reassuring. In fact, I would quite enjoy it if some kind of bizarre incident were to occur now. I just hope I don't have to play the part of the victim."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "How reassuring. It almost sounds as though you want a bizarre crime to occur. I hope I don't have to play the part of the victim."
PC Japanese (JP): 「頼もしいじゃないか。むしろ何か、怪事件が起こって欲しいものだね。犠牲者役は御免被るが。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「頼もしいじゃないか。むしろ何か、怪事件が起こって欲しいものだね。犠牲者役は御免蒙るが」
Russian (RU): "Как обнадёживает. Почти звучит так, словно ты хочешь, чтобы произошло преступление. Надеюсь, мне не придётся играть роль жертвы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É mesmo reconfortante. Na verdade, eu até que aproveitaria se algum tipo de incidente bizarro acontecesse agora. Só espero que eu não tenha que fazer o papel de vítima."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「真靠得住呢。這反倒叫人，不由得希望發生奇案了呢。不過，犧牲者一職就免了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「真靠得住呢。这反倒叫人，不由得希望发生奇案了呢。不过，牺牲者一职就免了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Come sei rassicurante. Sembra quasi che tu voglia che accada un crimine bizzarro. Spero di non dover fare la parte della vittima."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "Dear, you mustn't say such things."
Umineko Project (UP): "Don't be imprudent, dear."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Dear, don't be imprudent."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あなた、不謹慎です。」
Russian (RU): "Дорогой, ты неблагоразумен."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Querido, não seja imprudente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「老公，這話可不太謹慎了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「老公，这话可不太谨慎了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Caro, non essere imprudente."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Well, the history of the Human mystery genre is only about a century old. Its tricks and ideas are limited to a few recycled patterns, so there's nothing left to show. No matter what kind of impossible crimes or closed room murders might occur, it'll be nothing more than one of the same classes of tricks dressed up to look like something new."
Umineko Project (UP): "Well, the history of the {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} mystery genre is only about a century old. Its tricks and ideas are limited to a few recycled patterns, so there's nothing left to show. No matter what kind of impossible crimes or locked‐room murders might occur, it'll be nothing more than one of the same classes of tricks dressed up to look like something new."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Well, the history of the human mystery genre is only about a century old. Its tricks and ideas are limited to a few recycled patterns, so there's nothing left to show. No matter what kind of impossible crimes or closed room murders might occur, it'll be nothing more than one of the same classes of tricks dressed up to look like something new."
PC Japanese (JP): 「まぁ。ニンゲンのミステリーの歴史なんて、ほんの百年足らず。そのトリックもアイデアも、ほんの数種の焼き直しですでに描くべきことなどありません。如何なる不可能犯罪、密室殺人が起ころうとも。すでに類型化されているどれかのトリックを、形を変えただけに過ぎないのですから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「まぁ。ニンゲンのミステリーの歴史なんて、ほんの百年足らず。そのトリックもアイデアも、ほんの数種の焼き直しですでに描くべきことなどありません。如何なる不可能犯罪、密室殺人が起ころうとも。すでに類型化されているどれかのトリックを、形を変えただけに過ぎないのですから」
Russian (RU): "Ну, истории {y:0:Челове}{n:0:челове}ческого детективного жанра всего около ста лет. Его приёмы и идеи ограничиваются несколькими переработанными схемами, и показывать уже нечего. Какие бы невозможные преступления или убийства в закрытых комнатах ни произошли, они будут теми же классическими трюками, представленными так, словно это нечто новое."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem, a história do gênero do mistério {y:0:Humano}{n:0:humano} já é quase centenária. Seus truques e ideias são limitados a um pequeno número de padrões repetitivos, logo não sobrou nada de novo para se mostrar. Não importa que tipo de crime impossível ou assassinato de quarto fechado possa ocorrer, não vai ser nada mais do que os mesmos truques padrões embelezados para parecerem algo novo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不過。人類推理劇的歷史，短短的不足百年。其中的詭計也好點子也罷，均是在重複那寥寥數種，已無當寫之物。畢竟，無論發生怎樣的不可能犯罪、密室殺人。最終都只不過是，把已類型化的某一詭計，換了個形式罷了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不过。人类推理剧的历史，短短的不足百年。其中的诡计也好点子也罢，均是在重复那寥寥数种，已无当写之物。毕竟，无论发生怎样的不可能犯罪、密室杀人。最终都只不过是，把已类型化的某一诡计，换了个形式罢了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Beh, la storia del genere giallo umano è iniziata solamente da cent'anni. {n}I suoi inganni e idee sono limitati a qualche modello riciclato, perciò non è rimasto nulla da mostrare. Per quanto impossibili siano i crimini o gli omicidi a stanza chiusa che potranno accadere, non sarà altro che uno degli stessi esempi di inganni agghindati in modo da sembrare qualcosa di nuovo."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "...The only reason mysteries still make for popular books today is because self-proclaimed "fans" —those who work off pieced-together knowledge and who have hardly read any of the classics— mistakenly think that a classic trick they didn't know about, through lack of proper study, is actually something new and surprising."
Umineko Project (UP): "......The only reason mysteries still make for popular books today...is because self‐proclaimed "fans", who work off pieced‐together knowledge and who have hardly read any of the classics, mistake classic tricks they didn't know about for something new and surprising through lack of proper study."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......The only reason mysteries still make for popular books today is because self-proclaimed 'fans'--those who work off pieced-together knowledge and who have hardly read any of the classics--mistakenly think that a classic trick they didn't know about, through lack of proper study, is actually something new and surprising."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……まぁ、それでもミステリーが読み物として現代でも通用するのは。古典もろくすっぽ読まない付け焼刃の自称マニアが、自分の不勉強ゆえに知らない古典トリックをさも新鮮であるかのように勘違いして大騒ぎしてるだけなんですが。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……まぁ、それでもミステリーが読み物として現代でも通用するのは。古典もろくすっぽ読まない付け焼刃の自称マニアが、自分の不勉強ゆえに知らない古典トリックをさも新鮮であるかのように勘違いして大騒ぎしてるだけなんですが」
Russian (RU): "......Детективный жанр ещё популярен лишь потому, что самопровозглашённые 'поклонники', отделывающиеся от знаний и даже вряд ли читавшие классику... Ошибочно полагают, будто классический трюк, о котором они не знали, потому что не приобретали знания, на самом деле нечто новое и удивительное."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O único motivo pelo qual os livros de mistério se mantém populares até hoje...é devido aos autoproclamados "fãs", que não buscam adquirir conhecimento e muito menos leram a maior parte dos grandes clássicos, e confundem truques tradicionais, que sequer conhecem, como sendo algo novo e surpreendente porque não estudaram o suficiente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……而即便如此，推理劇卻還能作為讀物地適用於現代。只不過是因為，那些連古典作品都不去好好讀下，趕鴨子上架的自稱狂熱愛好者的人，在將自己不做功課而不知道的古典詭計，誤以為很新鮮地瞎起哄。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……而即便如此，推理剧却还能作为读物地适用于现代。只不过是因为，那些连古典作品都不去好好读下，赶鸭子上架的自称狂热爱好者的人，在将自己不做功课而不知道的古典诡计，误以为很新鲜地瞎起哄。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... L'unica ragione per cui i gialli sono tutt'oggi libri alla moda è il fatto che coloro che si autodefiniscono ‘fan’ coloro che si sbarazzano della conoscenza accumulatasi e che raramente hanno letto uno qualunque dei classici―pensano erroneamente che un classico trucco che non conoscevano, a causa della mancanza di uno studio appropriato, sia in realtà qualcosa di nuovo e sorprendente."

Steam (ST): Everyone couldn't help but gape at this imposing claim...
Umineko Project (UP): Everyone couldn't help but gape at this imposing claim...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): あまりの大言に、一同もあんぐりと口を開けてしまう…。
Russian (RU): Остальные не могли не поразиться этому внушительному заявлению...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos acabaram ficando de boca aberta diante da petulância dela...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 聽了這過於出格的豪言大話，眾人都不禁張大了嘴…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 听了这过于出格的豪言大话，众人都不禁张大了嘴…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ognuno non poteva che restare a bocca aperta per quest'imponente affermazione...

Steam (ST): If an aged critic had said it, that would have been one thing. ...But to think that a young person like this could say it so boldly...
Umineko Project (UP): If an aged critic had said it, that would have been one thing. ......But it showed incredible boldness for a young person like her to state that so strongly...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If an aged critic had said it, that would have been one thing.......But to think that a young person like this could say it so boldly...
PC Japanese (JP): 齢を経た批評家が言うならいざ知れず。……よくもこのような若輩の身でそのようなことが堂々と言えるものだ…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "That's ridiculous. ......It's not like there's any need to read more books than everyone else just for its own sake, but on the other hand, you can't be so satisfied with just a few stories like that. ...Sticking to classics of the past and never reading anything new is a sign of excessive nostalgia, don't you think? That sounds to me like the excuse of an old person who can't be bothered to read more."
Umineko Project (UP): "Nah, that's ridiculous. .........Books aren't a competition—it's not about who's read the most—but boasting that you've read all you ever need to read is just as wrong‐headed. ......Just reading classics of the past and never anything new is being overly nostalgic, don't you think? That sounds to me like the excuse of an old person who's too lazy to read anything."

That sounds to me like the excuse of an old person who's too lazy to read anything."

È il metodo più basilare per costruire delle aperture nelle stanze chiuse della strega."

Russian (RU): Через тонкую щель приоткрытой двери вливался свет из коридора...... и, казалось бы, нёс с собой смех — тёплый и счастливый, но очень далёкий...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma luz do corredor vazava através da pequena fresta da porta entreaberta......e parecia carregar consigo uma risada calorosa e alegre, mas ainda muito distante...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我感到那從微開著的門縫間漏入的走廊上的燈光，……好像甚至是有一併送來，遠方的溫暖、開心的笑聲…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我感到那从微开着的门缝间漏入的走廊上的灯光，……好像甚至是有一并送来，远方的温暖、开心的笑声…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La luce proveniente dal corridoio entrò attraverso la piccola apertura della porta leggermente socchiusa... e sembrava portare con sé delle risate calde e felici, ma molto distanti...

Steam (ST): I'm sure everyone's in the dining hall or somewhere, having a good time...
Umineko Project (UP): I'm sure everyone's in the dining hall or somewhere, having a good time...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm sure everyone's in the dining hall or somewhere, having a good time...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos devem estar se divertindo muito na sala de jantar...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大家肯定無疑是正聚在餐廳或別的什麼地方，開心玩樂…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大家肯定无疑是正聚在餐厅或别的什么地方，开心玩乐…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sono sicuro che tutti si stiano divertendo nella sala da pranzo o da qualche altra parte...

Steam (ST): I want to go there as soon as I can...
Umineko Project (UP): I want to go there as soon as I can...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I want to go there as soon as I can...

Russian (RU): Хочу скорее туда...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu quero ir logo para lá...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 好想快点去那…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Voglio andarci il più presto possibile...

Umineko Project (UP): .........I'm sure my family will be there...{n}I hate being all alone in a place like this......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........I'm sure my family will be there... I hate being all alone in a place like this......

Russian (RU): .........Там точно будет и моя семья...{n}Я не хочу быть один в таком месте......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Tenho certeza que minha família também está lá...{n}Eu odeio ficar sozinho em um lugar como esse......

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): I stubbornly tried again and again to get that door open, but the merciless chain just wouldn't let it open any further than that crack.
Umineko Project (UP): I stubbornly tried again and again to open the door, but the merciless chain just wouldn't let the door open any further than that crack.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I stubbornly tried again and again to open the door, but the merciless chain just wouldn't let the door open any further than that crack.
PC Japanese (JP): 何度未練がましく扉を開こうとしても、無慈悲な鎖、……チェーンは決してそれ以上の隙間を許さない。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 尽管我在一遍又一遍锲而不舍地尝试开门，但无情的锁、……门链乃是绝对不容把这条缝开得更大。

Steam (ST): On the contrary, feeling this close to a way out just made me more impatient.
Umineko Project (UP): On the contrary, feeling this close to a way out just made me more impatient.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On the contrary, feeling this close to a way out just made me more impatient.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pelo contrário, esse sentimento de que estou quase conseguindo só me deixa ainda mais impaciente.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 莫如说，仅是在煽动“再差一点点就能出去了“的，焦躁罢了。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Gulping and trying to ignore the fear lurking behind me, ......I quietly closed the door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Engolindo em seco e tentando ignorar o medo que espreitava atrás de mim, ......eu silenciosamente fechei a porta.

Umineko Project (UP): That light coming out of the crack......is just a trap.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That light coming out of the crack......is just a trap.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A luz que passava pela fresta......era apenas uma armadilha.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La luce che entra dalla fessura... è solo una trappola.

Umineko Project (UP): This is an iron shackle, trying to keep me locked in here for eternity by making me think I'm just an inch away from getting out a door that will never actually open......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This is an iron shackle, trying to keep me locked in here for eternity by making me think I'm just an inch away from getting out a door that will never actually open......
PC Japanese (JP): 決して開かぬ扉なのに、もう少しで出られるかのように錯覚させて、……永遠に自分をここに閉じ込めようとする、鉄の枷……。
Russian (RU): Эти железные оковы пытаются навечно запереть меня здесь, наводя на мысль, что я всего в одном дюйме от выхода, который на самом деле никогда не откроется......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esta é uma manilha de aço, tentando me manter preso aqui por toda a eternidade, me fazendo pensar que estou a alguns centímetros de sair pela porta, quando na verdade ela nunca se abrirá......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 令人把絕對開不了的門，誤會成再稍微加把勁就能打開，……最終致使人自己把自己永遠地關於此處的、鐵鐐……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 令人把绝对开不了的门，误会成再稍微加把劲就能打开，……最终致使人自己把自己永远地关于此处的、铁镣……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questa è una catena di ferro, che cerca di tenermi confinato qui per l'eternità facendomi pensare che sono ad un passo dall'uscire dalla porta che in realtà non si aprirà mai...

Steam (ST): I need to get out of this creepy room... ...As soon as possible...
Umineko Project (UP): I need to get out of this creepy room...{n}......As soon as possible...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I need to get out of this creepy room.........As soon as possible...

Umineko Project (UP): When I closed the door, all that filled the room was that eerie sound of wind and rain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I closed the door, all that filled the room was that eerie sound of wind and rain.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): The way the wind picked up every now and then and shook the window frame felt like a monster in a cage shaking the bars...

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 時折、風が強くなり窓枠をがたがたとふるわせるのはまるで、檻の中の怪物が鉄格子を揺するかのようだった…。

Russian (RU): Стекло с громким треском разбилось, рама застонала и заскрипела.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O vidro se partiu com um som violento e a esquadria tremeu e gemeu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 隨著劇烈的響聲，窗玻璃碎得四散飛濺，窗框“嘎吱嘎吱”地哭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 随着剧烈的响声，窗玻璃碎得四散飞溅，窗框“嘎吱嘎吱”地哭。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il vetro si ruppe con un suono violento, e il telaio scricchiolò.

Steam (ST): Smash it, smash it. Over and over.
Umineko Project (UP): I hit it again. Again. Over and over.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Smash it, smash it. Over and over.
PC Japanese (JP): 打ち付ける打ち付ける。何度も何度も。
Russian (RU): Бить, бить по ней. Раз за разом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu bati de novo. De novo. E bati de novo e de novo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我砸、我砸。一下又一下，一下又一下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Frantumala, frantumala. Ancora e ancora.

Steam (ST): If I can just break through the wooden grid...!
Umineko Project (UP): If I can just break through this wooden frame......!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I can just break through the wooden grid......!
PC Japanese (JP): この木製格子を打ち破れば……！
Russian (RU): Осталось только пробить эту деревянную решётку!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ao menos eu pudesse quebrar essa grade de madeira......!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只要砸爛這木製窗格……！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只要砸烂这木制窗格……！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se solo potessi rompere il telaio in legno...!

Steam (ST): ...Dammit...what...the hell...
Umineko Project (UP): ......Dammit......what...the hell...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……くそ、……何だよ、これ…。
Russian (RU): ......Проклятье...... что за... чёрт...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Droga......que merda...é essa...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……可惡，……什麼呀，這個…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……可恶，……什么呀，这个…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Dannazione... che... diavolo...

Steam (ST): Even though the glass had been smashed apart, ...even though the cold rain that blew in tormented me, ...I just couldn't get that grid to break...!
Umineko Project (UP): Even though all the glass has been smashed apart, ......even though the cold rain is blowing in and tormenting me, ......I just can't get that frame to break...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though the glass had been smashed apart, ......even though the cold rain that blew in tormented me, ......I just couldn't get that grid to break...!
PC Japanese (JP): ガラスはもう、破れ障子のようにみんな打ち破られてるのに、……そこから吹き込んでくる雨粒が冷たく苛むのに、……どうしても格子だけが壊れない…！
Russian (RU): Несмотря на разбитое стекло...... несмотря на обрушившийся на меня холодный дождь...... я никак не могу сломать эту решётку!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo com o vidro tendo se partido em pedaços, ......mesmo com a chuva fria soprando para dentro e me atormentando, ......eu não consigo quebrar essa grade de madeira...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 窗玻璃，明明都已如戳爛了的窗戶紙般全被砸碎了，……我明明都已在透心涼地被從那吹進的冰冷雨滴淋了，……可那窗格竟是無論如何都砸不爛…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 窗玻璃，明明都已如戳烂了的窗户纸般全被砸碎了，……我明明都已在透心凉地被从那吹进的冰冷雨滴淋了，……可那窗格竟是无论如何都砸不烂…！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche se il vetro era stato fatto a pezzi... anche se la fredda pioggia che entrava mi tormentava... semplicemente non riuscivo a spaccare quel telaio...!

Steam (ST): They weren't iron bars. It was just a slender wooden mesh...
Umineko Project (UP): They aren't iron bars.{n}It's just a delicate wooden mesh...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They weren't iron bars. It was just a slender wooden mesh...
PC Japanese (JP): 鉄格子ってわけじゃない。見るからに華奢そうな、木製の格子なのに…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 鉄格子ってわけじゃない。{n}見るからに華奢そうな、木製の格子なのに…。
Russian (RU): Это не железные прутья.{n}Просто тонкая деревянная сетка...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não são barras de ferro.{n}É só uma delicada gelosia de madeira...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 又不是鐵做的窗格。{n}明明是看著就覺得不結實的，木製窗格…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 又不是铁做的窗格。{n}明明是看着就觉得不结实的，木制窗格…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non c'erano sbarre di ferro. Erano solo delle sottili aste di legno...

Steam (ST): Even though it's fragile enough to make that creaking sound, why doesn't it break...?!
Umineko Project (UP): It's fragile enough to make that creaking sound, so why doesn't it break...?!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though it's fragile enough to make that creaking sound, why doesn't it break...?!
PC Japanese (JP): こんなぎしぎし言うくらいに華奢そうなのに、何で壊れないんだ…？！
Russian (RU): Она такая хрупкая, что постоянно скрипит, так почему она не ломается?!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É frágil o suficiente para ranger, então por que não quebra...?!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明明是這般“嘎吱嘎吱”響地不結實，可為什麼就是砸不爛…？！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明是这般“嘎吱嘎吱”响地不结实，可为什么就是砸不烂…？！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche se sono tanto fragile da scricchiolare, perché non si rompono...?!

Steam (ST): No wait, maybe it's almost broken. What if I try attacking it from a different angle instead of just smashing it head on?
Umineko Project (UP): No wait, maybe it's close to breaking.{n}What if I try attacking it from a different angle instead of just smashing it head on?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]
PC Japanese (JP): いや、あと少しで壊せるんじゃないか？正面から叩くんじゃなくて、力の加減かもしれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): いや、あと少しで壊せるんじゃないか？{n}正面から叩くんじゃなくて、力の加減かもしれない。
Russian (RU): Нет, стоп, вдруг она уже почти сломана.{n}Что если ударить по ней под другим углом, а не просто бить напрямую?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não, espera, talvez esteja prestes a quebrar.{n}E se eu bater de um ângulo diferente ao invés ficar forçando no mesmo ponto?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不，會不會是再稍微努力下就能搞定了呢？{n}不要去從正面砸，也許是力道用法的問題。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不，会不会是再稍微努力下就能搞定了呢？{n}不要去从正面砸，也许是力道用法的问题。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): No aspetta, forse sta per rompersi. E se provassi a colpirlo da un angolo diverso invece di continuare ad attaccarlo frontalmente?

Steam (ST): I stuck my left hand outside through the hole in the broken latticed window, grabbed the frame from the front with my right hand, and tried to break it by shaking it around from both sides.
Umineko Project (UP): I stuck my left hand outside through one of the holes in the broken window, grabbed the frame from the front with my right hand, and tried to break it by shaking it around from both sides.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I stuck my left hand outside through the hole in the broken latticed window, grabbed the frame from the front with my right hand, and tried to break it by shaking it around from both sides.
PC Japanese (JP): 破れた格子窓の隙間から左手を外に突き出し、右手は正面から窓枠を掴み、前と後からぎしぎしと揺すって、何とか壊せないか試みる。
Russian (RU): Я высунул левую руку через отверстие в сломанном решётчатом окне, правой рукой схватил раму и попытался сломать её, тряся с обеих сторон.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu enfiei minha mão esquerda através de um dos buracos da janela quebrada, agarrei a grande com a minha mão direita, e tentei quebrá‐la sacudindo para ambos os lados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我的左手從砸碎了玻璃的窗格伸到了外面，右手從正面抓住窗框，一前一後“嘎吱嘎吱”地搖了起來，試圖拆掉窗戶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我的左手从砸碎了玻璃的窗格伸到了外面，右手从正面抓住窗框，一前一后“嘎吱嘎吱”地摇了起来，试图拆掉窗户。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Misi la mano fuori attraverso il buco nella finestra, afferrai il telaio con la mano destra, e cercai di romperlo agitandolo da entrambi i lati.

Steam (ST): My left hand started to grow ice-cold from the frigid winds and rain...
Umineko Project (UP): My left hand started to grow ice‐cold from the frigid winds and rain...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): My left hand started to grow ice-cold from the frigid winds and rain...
PC Japanese (JP): 突き出した左手は、風雨でどんどん冷え切っていく…。
Russian (RU): Моя рука начала леденеть от холодного ветра и дождя...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Minha mão esquerda começou a ficar cada vez mais gelada por causa do vento frio e da chuva...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 伸在外面的左手，因風雨而越來越涼…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 伸在外面的左手，因风雨而越来越凉…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La mia mano sinistra iniziava a congelarsi per il vento e la pioggia...

Steam (ST): ...When I shook it, fragments of glass sticking out from the broken frame poked into me, and my wrist was soon stained with blood.
Umineko Project (UP): ......As I shook, fragments of glass sticking out from the broken frame poked into me, and my wrist was soon stained with blood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……揺する時に、破った窓枠から突き出すガラスの破片がチクチクと刺さって、すぐに手首は血まみれになった。
Russian (RU): ......Пока я продолжал трясти, в меня впивались осколки стекла, торчащие из сломанной рамы, и моё запястье окрасилось кровью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Enquanto eu sacudia, cacos do vidro quebrado começaram a me arranhar, e logo meu punho ficou manchado de sangue.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在搖窗子時，直立在窗格子上的碎玻璃“呲喇喇”地劃破皮膚，手腕馬上即變得沾滿了血。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在摇窗子时，直立在窗格子上的碎玻璃“呲喇喇”地划破皮肤，手腕马上即变得沾满了血。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Mentre scuotevo, frammenti di vetro che fuoriuscivano dalla finestra rotta si incagliavano dentro di me, e il mio polso si cosparse in fretta di sangue.

Steam (ST): But...if I can just get out of here, this much pain is no big deal.
Umineko Project (UP): But...if I can just get out of here, this much pain is no big deal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But...if I can just get out of here, this much pain is no big deal.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、ここから出られるなら、この程度のこと、何ということはなかった。
Russian (RU): Хотя... если я могу выйти отсюда, эта боль не так уж и страшна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas...se for para sair daqui, essa dor não é nada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，只要能從這出去，這點程度的小傷，根本算不了什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，只要能从这出去，这点程度的小伤，根本算不了什么。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma... se solo potessi uscire di qui, questo dolore non sarebbe un grande problema.

Steam (ST): But, ...I can't get out. I'm stuck. It won't open... I can't break it...!
Umineko Project (UP): But, ......I can't get out. I'm stuck.{n}It won't open... I can't break it......!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But, ......I can't get out. I'm stuck. It won't open...I can't break it......!
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、……出れない。出られない。開かない、壊れない……！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、……出れない。出られない。{n}開かない、壊れない……！
Russian (RU): Но...... я не могу выйти. Я застрял.{n}Она не открывается... У меня не выходит сломать её!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas ......eu não consegui sair. Estou preso.{n}Não abre... Eu não consigo quebrar......!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，……出不去。無法出去。{n}打不開，拆不下來……！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，……出不去。无法出去。{n}打不开，拆不下来……！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma... non posso uscire. Sono bloccato. Non si aprirà... non posso romperla...!

Steam (ST): The more violently I shook the frame, the more the glass fragments tore into my left wrist, causing me intense pain. ...Wait, what's...huh? Ow, ...owowowowow?!
Umineko Project (UP): The more violently I shook the frame, the more the glass fragments tore into my left wrist, causing me intense pain. ......Wait, what's......huh? Ow, ...owowowowow?!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The more violently I shook the frame, the more the glass fragments tore into my left wrist, causing me intense pain. ......Wait, what's......huh? Ow, ...owowowowow?!
PC Japanese (JP): 乱暴にがしゃがしゃと窓枠を揺すれば揺するほど、左手首がガラスの破片に切りつけられて激しく痛む。……いや、これ、……え？　痛て、…痛てててててててッ？！
Russian (RU): Чем яростнее я трясу раму, тем больше осколков впивается в моё левое запястье, причиняя сильную боль. ......Стоп, что...... э? Ой... ой‐ой‐ой‐ой?!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quanto mais violentamente eu sacudia, mais os fragmentos cortavam meu punho esquerdo, causando uma dor intensa. ......Espera, o que é isso......quê?{n}Ai, ...aiaiaiaiai?!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我越是“嘎咭嘎咭”地狠搖窗框，左手手腕就越是遭碎玻璃摧殘，傳來劇痛。……不，這是，……哎？好痛，…痛痛痛痛痛痛痛痛？！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我越是“嘎咭嘎咭”地狠摇窗框，左手手腕就越是遭碎玻璃摧残，传来剧痛。……不，这是，……哎？好痛，…痛痛痛痛痛痛痛痛？！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Più scuotevo il telaio con violenza, più i frammenti di vetro si infilavano nel mio polso sinistro, causandomi un dolore atroce. ... Aspetta, cosa... huh? Ow... owowowowow?!

Steam (ST): Before I realized it, the glass fragments on the frame had extended outwards.
Umineko Project (UP): Before I realized it, the glass fragments on the frame had grown longer and more spiky.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Before I realized it, the glass fragments on the frame had extended outwards.
PC Japanese (JP): いつの間にか、左手を通した格子のガラス破片が、鋭く伸びているのだ。
Russian (RU): Не успел я осознать, как осколки на раме высунулись наружу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Antes que eu pudesse perceber, os fragmentos de vidro que ficaram na esquadria da janela ficaram ainda maiores e mais pontiagudos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不知從何時起，我左手鑽過的那格窗格的碎玻璃，銳不可當地長長了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不知从何时起，我左手钻过的那格窗格的碎玻璃，锐不可当地长长了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prima che me ne accorgessi, i frammenti sul telaio si erano estesi verso l'esterno.

Steam (ST): It was as though an ugly beast was trying to chew my hand off with glass teeth.
Umineko Project (UP): It was as though an ugly beast was trying to chew my hand off with glass teeth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was as though an ugly beast was trying to chew my hand off with glass teeth.
PC Japanese (JP): それはまるで、醜悪な魔物のガラスの歯が、俺の手を食い千切ろうとしているかのようだった。
Russian (RU): Словно уродливый зверь пытался стеклянными зубами прожевать мою руку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como uma besta asquerosa tentando mastigar meu punho com seus dentes de vidro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而這簡直就像是醜惡魔物的玻璃利齒，正在意圖咬斷我的手。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而这简直就像是丑恶魔物的玻璃利齿，正在意图咬断我的手。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era come se un'orrenda bestia stesse cercando di staccarmi la mano con dei denti di vetro.

Steam (ST): It didn't just feel as though they were growing outwards.
Umineko Project (UP): It's not my imagination.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It didn't just feel as though they were growing outwards.
PC Japanese (JP): 伸びているような気、じゃない。
Russian (RU): Мне не просто казалось, что они увеличиваются.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era minha imaginação.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 並不是感覺它長長了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 并不是感觉它长长了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non era come se sentissi che stavano crescendo verso l'esterno.

Steam (ST): They actually were getting longer before my very eyes, ...aaaah, and they're chewing my hand to bits...!!
Umineko Project (UP): They actually {i:are} getting longer before my very eyes, .......aaaah, and they're chewing my hand to bits...!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They actually were getting longer before my very eyes, .......aaaah, and they're chewing my hand to bits...!!
PC Japanese (JP): 今もまさに伸びていて、……うわ、わッ、俺の手を……食い千切る…！！
Russian (RU): Они действительно на моих глазах становились длиннее....... а‐а‐а‐а, и они разжёвывают мою руку!!!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles realmente {i:estão} ficando maiores bem diante dos meus olhos, .......aaaah, e estão mastigando minha mão...!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此刻都還在長，……嗚哇、哇，正死死咬住……我的手…！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此刻都还在长，……呜哇、哇，正死死咬住……我的手…！！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si stavano davvero allungando davanti ai miei occhi... aaaah, e stanno facendo a pezzi la mia mano...!!

Steam (ST): I tried desperately to pull my hand out, but it had already dug deep into my wrist, and I couldn't move it.
Umineko Project (UP): I tried desperately to pull my hand out, but it had already dug deep into my wrist, and I couldn't move it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 手を乱暴に引き抜こうとするが、ちょうど手首のところでざっくりと食いつかれ、引き抜けなくなる。
Russian (RU): Я отчаянно пытался вытащить руку, но они уже пробились глубоко в моё запястье, и я не мог ею двигать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tentei desesperadamente puxar minha mão, mas já estava profundamente cravado no meu punho e eu não consegui mais movê‐lo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然我粗暴亂動地想把手拔出來，但它正好一口咬住了手腕處，怎都拔不出來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然我粗暴乱动地想把手拔出来，但它正好一口咬住了手腕处，怎都拔不出来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Provai disperatamente a tirare fuori la mano, ma si erano già infilati in profondità nel mio polso, e non potevo muoverlo.

Steam (ST): I put all my strength into it, but it just hurt more and more, and the glass didn't even budge...!
Umineko Project (UP): I put all my strength into it, but it just hurt more and more, and the glass didn't even budge...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I put all my strength into it, but it just hurt more and more, and the glass didn't even budge...!
PC Japanese (JP): 力を込めて引っ張るが、ものすごい痛みばかりで、食いついたガラスはびくともしない…！
Russian (RU): Я приложил все силы, но это только ещё больше вредило, а стекло даже не шелохнулось!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu concentrei todas as minhas forças nisso, mas só doía cada vez mais, e os vidros não se moviam um centímetro...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我使勁地拔，然而這只是帶來了非同尋常的劇痛，咬住我的手的碎玻璃紋絲不動…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我使劲地拔，然而这只是带来了非同寻常的剧痛，咬住我的手的碎玻璃纹丝不动…！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ci misi tutta la mia forza, ma faceva solamente più male, e il vetro non si muoveva neanche...!

Steam (ST): What...the...hell...?!! D-Dammit, let go...let go, let go...!!
Umineko Project (UP): What...the...hell...?!! D‐dammit, let go......let go, let go...!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): What...the...hell...?!! D, dammit, let go......let go, let go..!!
PC Japanese (JP): なん、だよッ、これ…！！　ち、畜生、離せ、……離せ離せ…！！
Russian (RU): Какого... чёрта?!! П‐проклятье, отпусти...... отпусти, отпусти!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas...que...merda..?! M‐Merda, me solta......solta, solta...!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 什、什麼呀，這個…！！畜、畜生，放開我的手，……放開放開…！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 什、什么呀，这个…！！畜、畜生，放开我的手，……放开放开…！！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma... che... diavolo...?!! M-Maledizione, lasciami andare... lasciami, lasciami..!!

Steam (ST): I hit the glass with my right fist over and over, but that just hurt my right fist and did nothing to release my other hand...
Umineko Project (UP): With my right fist, I hit the glass over and over attempting to break it, but that just hurt my right fist as well and did nothing to release my other hand...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I hit the glass with my right fist over and over, but that just hurt my right fist and did nothing to release my other hand...
PC Japanese (JP): 右手の拳骨でガラスを割ろうと何度も叩くが、ガラスの痛みを右拳にも味わわせるだけで、決して食らいついたそれを離そうとしない…。
Russian (RU): Я снова и снова бил по стеклу правым кулаком, но это только повреждало правую руку и ничуть не освобождало другую...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com meu punho direito, eu bati contra o vidro diversas vezes na tentativa de quebrá‐lo, mas isso só machucou meu punho direito e não fui capaz de soltar a outra mão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 想著以右手拳骨敲碎玻璃地，砸了好幾拳，不過這僅是讓右手也嘗到了被玻璃弄傷的痛楚，完全沒對令它鬆口起到任何作用…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 想着以右手拳骨敲碎玻璃地，砸了好几拳，不过这仅是让右手也尝到了被玻璃弄伤的痛楚，完全没对令它松口起到任何作用…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Colpii ripetutamente il vetro con la mia mano destra, ma servì solo a ferirla e non servì a nulla per liberare l'altra mano...

Steam (ST): Just then, ......my left hand, which was still exposed to the rain outside, brushed against... something slimy...
Umineko Project (UP): Just then, ............my left hand, which was still stuck outside and exposed to the rain, brushed against...something slimy...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just then, ............my left hand, which was still stuck outside and exposed to the rain, brushed against... something slimy...
PC Japanese (JP): その時、…………ガラスに食いつかれて、外に突き出して雨曝しになったままの左手に、何かが、ぬめりと、触れた…。

Russian (RU): И вдруг............ левой рукой, застрявшей под дождём снаружи, я задел... нечто скользкое...

Umineko Project (UP): It couldn't have been a leaf blown about by the winds, or anything like that...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]

Umineko Project (UP): Then, ......it closed tightly around my left hand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, ......it closed tightly around my left hand.

Umineko Project (UP): When I felt the five fingers, ......I knew that some person out in the darkness was touching my left hand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I felt the five fingers, ......I knew that some person out in the darkness was touching my left hand.

Umineko Project (UP): And............yes...I know who it is......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And............yes... I know who it is......

Umineko Project (UP): It's the witch... The terrifying witch who controls Rokkenjima's night......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It's the witch... The terrifying witch who controls Rokkenjima's night......

Umineko Project (UP): The two hands soaked in the freezing rain......gently caressed my left hand.

PC Japanese (JP): 自分のことのはずなのに、……まるでわからない。だから肖像画の自分の瞳を、……静かに見つめる。

Umineko Project (UP): And then, ......she lightly.........touched it......

That fool Kinzo is still so desperate to catch me or revive me. How truly ironic. Here I am, openly controlling the mansion every night. *cackle*cackle*!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうとも、右代宮の屋敷のホールである。……夜は妾の時間。そして夜の屋敷は妾のものだ。金蔵の間抜けは、相変わらず妾を蘇らせようだの捕らえようだのと躍起になっている。皮肉な話よ。その妾は、こうして堂々と毎晩、屋敷を支配しているというのに。くっくっくっく！」
Russian (RU): "Именно. Мы в зале особняка Уширомия. ......Ночь — моё время. И ночью особняк тоже мой. Дурак Кинзо до сих пор так отчаянно пытается захватить меня или возродить. Какая ирония. Вот я, открыто управляю особняком каждую ночь. *хи‐хи*хи‐хи*!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Exatamente. Este é o hall da mansão Ushiromiya. ......A noite é o meu domínio. Bem como a noite da mansão também me pertence. Aquele tolo do Kinzo continua desesperado tentando me pegar ou me reviver. É mesmo irônico. Afinal eu estou aqui, controlando abertamente a mansão, todas as noites. *gargalhada*gargalhada*!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「對，是右代宮大屋的門廳。……夜晚是妾身的時間。而夜晚的大屋屬於妾身。金藏那個蠢蛋，依舊還在拚命竭力地想要復甦妾身，抓住妾身。真是諷刺喲。他想抓的妾身，明明是在像這樣光明正大地，每晚都統治著大屋。呵呵呵呵！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「对，是右代宫大屋的门厅。……夜晚是妾身的时间。而夜晚的大屋属于妾身。金藏那个蠢蛋，依旧还在拼命竭力地想要复苏妾身，抓住妾身。真是讽刺哟。他想抓的妾身，明明是在像这样光明正大地，每晚都统治着大屋。呵呵呵呵！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Precisamente. Questo è l'atrio di villa Ushiromiya. ... La notte è il mio momento. E anche la villa di notte mi appartiene. Quello sciocco di un Kinzo è ancora così disperato nel catturarmi o resuscitarmi. Che ironia. Eccomi qua, mentre controllo apertamente la villa ogni notte. *cackle*cackle*!"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...I have lost my body, and due to the effects of that hateful shrine, I have no magical energy. However, my power is reviving bit by bit every day. ...I can't wait to eventually undergo a spectacular resurrection and have a good laugh at Kinzo. I can't wait to tell him that I've succeeded in escaping from his cage...! Simply put, I'm a ghost killing time by wandering about night after night, with nothing to look forward to besides teaching that old man a lesson."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I have lost my body, and due to the effects of that hateful shrine, I have no magical power. However, I am reviving that magical power bit by bit every day. ......My ultimate goal is to undergo a spectacular resurrection and gloat to Kinzo. I cannot wait to tell him that I have succeeded in escaping his cage...! For now, I have become something of a ghost, wandering about and killing time every night, all in anticipation of that gloating grin."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I have lost my body, and due to the effects of that hateful shrine, I have no magical power. However, I am reviving that magical power bit by bit every day. ......I can't wait to undergo a spectacular resurrection at the end so that I can taunt that Kinzo. I can't wait to tell him that I've succeeded in escaping from his cage...! I have become a ghost wandering about and killing time every night just so that I can look forward to that smile."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……体を失い、あの憎々しい鎮守の社により魔力もない。しかし、わずかずつに日々、魔力は蘇りつつあるのだ。……最後には見事復活を遂げ、あの金蔵を嘲笑ってやりたいぞ。妾は見事、そなたの檻を抜け出したとな…！　その笑いだけを楽しみに、夜な夜な徘徊して暇潰しをしている亡霊といったところよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……体を失い、あの憎々しい鎮守の社により魔力もない。しかし、わずかずつに日々、魔力は蘇りつつあるのだ。……最後には見事復活を遂げ、あの金蔵を嘲笑ってやりたいぞ。妾は見事、そなたの檻を抜け出したとな…！　その笑いだけを楽しみに、夜な夜な徘徊して暇潰しをしている亡霊といったところよ」
Russian (RU): "......Я лишилась своего тела, и из‐за той ненавистной святыни у меня нет магической силы. Но я понемногу возвращаю её день за днём. ......Не могу дождаться захватывающего воскрешения, когда смогу подразнить Кинзо. Не терпится сказать ему, что мне удалось вырваться из его клетки!.. Я стала призраком, блуждающим и убивающим время из ночи в ночь, и всё ради той улыбки."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu perdi meu corpo, e devido aos efeitos daquele detestável santuário, eu não tenho poderes mágicos. Contudo, a cada dia que passa eu revivo um pouco do meu poder. ......Meu objetivo é passar por uma espetacular ressurreição e regozijar diante de Kinzo. Mal posso esperar para dizer a ele que eu consegui escapar de sua gaiola...! Por ora, eu sou uma espécie de fantasma, vagando por aí e matando tempo todas as noites, tudo em antecipação ao meu grande regozijo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……失去了身體，因那可恨的鎮守御社魔力也沒了。不過，每天一點一點，魔力有在慢慢恢復。……到最後漂亮地完成復活，妾身要好好地嘲笑下那個金藏。笑著對他講，妾身漂亮地逃出了汝的牢籠…！妾身是在這當，以這嘲笑為唯一的盼頭，每天晚上四處徘徊打發閑暇的亡靈喲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……失去了身体，因那可恨的镇守御社魔力也没了。不过，每天一点一点，魔力有在慢慢恢复。……到最后漂亮地完成复活，妾身要好好地嘲笑下那个金藏。笑着对他讲，妾身漂亮地逃出了汝的牢笼…！妾身是在这当，以这嘲笑为唯一的盼头，每天晚上四处徘徊打发闲暇的亡灵哟。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Ho perso il mio corpo, e per colpa degli effetti di quell'odioso santuario non ho poteri magici. Tuttavia, sto riacquistando quel potere magico poco alla volta ogni giorno. ... Non vedo l'ora di sottopormi a una resurrezione spettacolare alla fine così da poter prendere in giro quel Kinzo. Non vedo l'ora di dirgli che sono riuscita a scappare dalla sua gabbia...! Sono diventata un fantasma che vaga e cerca di ammazzare il tempo ogni notte solo per poter aspettare di gustarmi quel sorriso."
